intro: Clematis barbellata var. barbellata, commonly known as the barbed clematis, is a vigorous climbing vine native to eastern Asia. It features compound leaves with serrated edges and produces showy, bell-shaped flowers in shades of white to pink. The plant thrives in full sun to partial shade and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. Its rapid growth habit makes it suitable for trellises or as a ground cover. It is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
